logicCircuitBuilder
Class Connection

java.lang.Object
  logicCircuitBuilder.Connection

public class Connection
extends java.lang.Object

Connection objects are the wires between the devices They are used just for drawing the lines no logic is implemented through them

Author:
vega

Constructor Summary
Connection(Output output, Input input)
          Creates a connection joining the Input input and Outputd output
 
Method Summary
 Input getInput()
          Used to remove a connection when one input has 2 incident connections
 void paintConnection(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)

Constructor Detail

Connection

Creates a connection joining the Input input and Outputd output

Method Detail

paintConnection

public void paintConnection(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
Paints the line between input and output connectors This is called by the paintComponent() method of the CircuitPanel

Parameters:
g2d - The Graphics2D object whic is used to paint the lines.

getInput

public Input getInput()
Used to remove a connection when one input has 2 incident connections

Returns:
the input connector to which the connector is drawn.
